page.title: 02HISTORY OF BASSALEG PARISH
page.content: Bassaleg grew up at a point where the Roman route to Caerphilly crossed the River Ebbw.There is evidence of Iron Age occupation on the nearby Gaer hillfort,and of a smaller Iron Age settlement on Court Farm. Records indicate that St.Basils Church in Bassaleg occupies a site of Christian worship from before Norman tims.After the Norman Conquest Bassaleg was bequeathed to the monks of Glastonbury who occupied a priory until 1216.Since then the fortunes of the area have been entwined with the Morgan family,who became prosperous landowners in the area.Their influence increased with advantageous marriages and the growth of the iron and coal masters. The Morgans were allied to both of these groups.Their historic home,Tredegar House is in Newport.
